programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin and Lucy visit a two-bedroom maisonette in Newcastle, a mid-terraced house in Telford, Shropshire and a three-bedroom property in Rochester, Kent. All of these properties have been sold at auction and well find out who bought them.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin and Lucy visit a three-bedroom detached property in Chatham in Kent, a terraced house in Blythe and a Georgian semi-detached house in Camberwell. All of these properties have been sold at auction and well find out who bought them.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin and Lucy visit a charming cottage in Stockton-on-Tees, a semi-detached house in Bexleyheath, Kent and a commercial unit in Dartmouth, Devon. All of these properties have been sold at auction and well find out who bought them.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A terraced house in Burnely in Lancashire, a bungalow on a big plot in Paddock Wood in Kent and a semi in Chaddesden in Derby all go under the hammer.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A large barn in Upwell in Norfolk, a period property in Folkestone in Kent and a house in Chesterton in Newcastle-under-Lyme are all in need of major TLC.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin and Lucy look around a trio of terraces in Stoke, Whitstable in Kent and the former mining village of Penrhiwceiber in Wales.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Two friends who buy a house in Cumbrias Maryport discover a bonus room they never knew existed. Elsewhere developers tackle a terraced house in Burton-upon-Trent, while in Deal in Kent an ambitious redevelopment of an ambulance hall gets under way.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A mid-terrace house near Birmingham, a flat in Londons vibrant Maida Hill and a bit of land in Scotlands historic Dunfermline catch the attention of property developers who have grand ideas - but will they go according to plan?

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A former railway workers cottage in Feniton in Devon, a terraced house in Cobridge in Stoke and a former Methodist chapel in Somercotes in Derbyshire are all sold under the hammer.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin and Lucy visit a house in Congleton in Cheshire, a one bedroom flat in Willesden in London and a former ambulance station in Port Talbot in Wales.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: An enormous semi in Rotherham, an impressive former chapel in Fraddon in Cornwall and a tiny terraced house in Putney in London go under the hammer.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy looks at a one-bedroom flat next to a train line in London with a hefty guide price, while Martin meets a father and son team working on a two-bedroom terrace in Abertillary. He also visits a pair of semis in Walderslade in Kent.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy meets a primary school teacher with a basement flat in East Dulwich in London, while Martin meets property developers in Ebbw Vale in Wales and Workington in Cumbria - both of whom have ambitious plans for kitchens and bathrooms.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Its a family affair for all three property projects in Port Talbot, Wimbledon and Telford. A father and daughter, cousins and a father and his two stepsons tackle projects bought at auction from just over £20,000 to more than £1.2 million.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy enjoys a day by the seaside visiting a two bedroom maisonette a few steps from the water in Kents Leysdown-on-Sea, while Martin has a look at a terraced house in Cymmer in the Welsh Valleys and a two bedroom mid-terrace in Penkhull near Stoke.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin looks around a terraced house in West Bromwich and another in Telford, while Lucy checks on progress 18-months after she first visited a bungalow on a large plot near Gillingham in Kent.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin visits a two-bedroom flat in Budleigh Salterton and a three-bed terrace in Downpatrick, Northern Ireland, which needs a new lease of life. Lucy meets the buyer of a plot of land in Abbey Wood, London, who has big plans for its future.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy catches up with a developer she met three years ago. This time he has an ambitious project turning two flats in a Victorian house in Hounslow into three. Martin meets two first-time developers working on projects in Glasgow and Tipton.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A flat in Edinburgh, a 1930s terraced house packed full with original features in Bromley in Kent and a five-bedroom house in Exeter in danger of falling down are all sold under the hammer.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A smart looking terrace with an expensive problem to fix in Pontygwaith in Wales, a large Victorian house in Okehampton in Devon and an old pub in Sittingbourne in Kent all go under the hammer.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin visits a listed shop in Hodnet in Shropshire and a property developer working on a maisonette in Ferndale in South Wales. Lucy follows a five-year project to restore a 17th-century listed building in Margate in Kent.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin and Lucy go flat-tastic looking around buildings which developers hope will create around a dozen flats. The properties sold under the hammer are in Stoke in Staffordshire, Bexleyheath in Kent and Gunnislake in Cornwall.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A five-bedroom house in Plymouth, a two-bed Victorian cottage in Croydon and a former coach house in Cardiff are sold under the hammer. Martin and Lucy meet the developers to hear about their plans to make the most of their auction buys.

programme.desc: Police find a giant sword bent in half, alongside a victim who has been savagely murdered. Investigators must sort through the details of his complicated life in order bring his killer to justice.

programme.desc: When a mans body is found in Denton canal, the ageing detective unravels the mystery of a missing dance partner and a web of intrigue involving blackmail, envy and murder.

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: Elderly Lily Armitage ventures into the ramshackle farm to visit her bedridden friend, Agnes. She does indeed find her - dead and locked in the freezer. Meanwhile, a mentally-challenged man disappears and pregnant teenager, Hilda Clemo, vanishes from her Cornish village. As fears for her safety grow, Wycliffe is brought in to search the fields and cliffs and question the family.

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The body of a church cleaner is discovered partially clothed and spread-eagled below the Cross. At first, a satanic cult is thought to be behind the killing, but Wycliffe has other suspicions. An air of hatred hangs in the village, and not all of it was directed at the murdered woman.

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: A fishing boat explodes in the bay killing its owner, Harry Tremaine - was it an accident or murder? Suspicion falls on his son, Freddie, who stands to inherit everything, but Wycliffe isnt convinced.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Sybils growing interest in politics lands her in trouble when Bates lets slip to Robert that she attended a rally with Branson. The saga of the wine thief is brought to a head after Bates makes a shocking revelation and hands in his notice. Edith seems to have found an unexpected admirer when Sir Anthony Strallan calls, and Carson receives a letter informing him of the rumours harming Mary.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Cora discovers she is pregnant, which leaves Mary wondering how to answer Matthews proposal, since his situation would change completely if the baby turns out to be a boy. Elsewhere, Mary accuses Edith of spreading the story that threatens to ruin her. Meanwhile, OBrien is angry when she suspects that Cora is going to replace her, so plans an accident for her mistress.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: The period drama returns for a second series. It is now 1916 and the family and servants are preparing the house for a benefits concert in aid of the local hospital. New housemaid Ethel has replaced Gwen but she soon has everyones backs up - and OBrien plays a cruel trick on her. Robert is now Lord Lieutenant of the County but is disappointed by not being at the front.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: It is April 1917 and, with most of the men away at the front, Carson is finding it tough maintaining standards in the house. Roberts new valet Henry Lang has just returned from the war, but OBrien is the only one to notice that he is not well. The suicide of a young officer prompts Isobel to suggest that they convert Downton into a convalescent hospital. Also, Mary hears that Matthew is returning.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: It is 1917 and Downton has been turned into a convalescent home for wounded officers. There is a lot to do, and the arrival of the first patients turns the house upside down. Matthew brings General Sir Herbert Strutt to inspect the home, unaware that Branson is planning to make the visit a memorable one. Meanwhile, Violet hopes to find skeletons in Lavinias closet.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Each year, the village of Angels Rise hosts the Psychic Fayre. Founded by the Saint-Stephens family in memory of their late daughter, the event attracts mediums, psychics and followers of the occult. When a body is found surrounded by ritual symbols on the eve of the festival, Barnaby must step into the spiritual world to find the killer.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Dr Martin Ellingham is the grumpy GP whose truculent and tactless manner upsets the community of Portwenn, as he tries to treat them for a variety of maladies and settle into the town.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: When the body of a missing 18-year-old is discovered buried on the moors, Vera delves beyond the original enquiry and into the life and the secrets of the victim.

programme.title: Coldwater
programme.desc: An unhappy middle-aged man who has moved to an isolated Scottish village strikes up a friendship with his oddball next door neighbour despite his wifes protestations and suspicions.

Taking the Zulus defiant stance on tribal customs as a declaration of war, the British commander sends in hundreds of British troops in order to squash the African warriors with superior fire power, leading to the death of 1,500 British soldiers.

programme.title: Johnny Handsome
programme.desc: A disfigured petty criminal is given plastic surgery in prison and, unrecognisable as his former self, plans his revenge on the ruthless associates who betrayed him. The doctor hopes the painful operations which give Johnny a new look will help him to reform, but he is bent on settling the score with the gang who killed his only friend and left him to carry the can for their last heist.

programme.desc: It is day two in Birmingham, and 37-year-old shopping channel producer Martha is hoping to educate - as well as entertain - her guests with a fully vegan feast. She hopes her vegetable extravaganza will win her the cash prize.

programme.desc: Visit two takes the BandBers to The Shuckburgh Arms in Stoke Doyle, Northamptonshire. Everyone goes barmy for their converted barns, but one guest isnt buzzing about a broken fridge disturbing his slumber.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Teen Mom OG
programme.desc: For four seasons fans of `Teen Mom watched Farrah, Maci, Amber and Catelynn face multiple challenges in their first years of motherhood, including such things as graduating from high school, relationships, getting jobs, beginning college and moving out on their own. Oh, and raising their first child. Now the original girls - hence, the `OG in the revived series title - return to reveal the challenges of raising children on camera, and how life in the public eye has shaped them as parents and people. Its an unprecedented view of young mothers facing the responsibilities of parenthood as their children enter kindergarten, start little league and reach other milestones of youth.

programme.title: Karen Morgan: Go Dawgs!
programme.desc: A former trial attorney, Karen Morgan moved from the courtroom to comedy after being selected as a finalist on Nickelodeon TVs `Search for the Funniest Mom in America.

programme.title: Ron Ruhman: Weird Stuff
programme.desc: Ron has been called a `High Energy Seinfeld. He brings a very energetic style to the stage as he shares his interesting slant on day-to-day life in an act that is clean, smart, and very entertaining.

programme.title: Landry: Hair Chronicles
programme.desc: Landry has a fresh, bold take on common tropes as he describes the difference between first-class passengers and everyone else, and more.

programme.title: Keith Stubbs: Poundcake
programme.desc: Keith Stubbs, a well-known name in showbiz, presents a hilarious stand-up comedy act wherein he takes a dig at the underworld, spyholes, and many other things.

programme.title: Jay Whittaker: Safe for Work
programme.desc: Jay Whittaker is a comedian, actor, host and writer hailing from Los Angeles and Salt Lake City.

programme.title: Jessi Campbell: The Sharpest Knife on the Porch
programme.desc: Jessi Campbell has recently been seen on `Last Comic Standing. She was the 2015 Campus Activities Magazine Female Performer of the Year, an award she was also nominated for in 2013.

programme.title: Shayne Smith: Prison for Wizards
programme.desc: Comedian and former gang member, Shayne Smith performs in a stand-up special.

programme.title: Tom Clark: Im a Rescue
programme.desc: Tom Clark was born and raised, in that order. Clarks mix of well-crafted jokes and spontaneous crowd work has led to appearances on TBSs, `Conan, CBSs `Late Late Show, and Comedy Centrals `Premium Blend.

programme.title: Jeff Big Daddy Wayne: Big Daddy Kicks It!
programme.desc: Comedian Jeff Wayne was dubbed `Big Daddy by Billy Crystal and Robin Williams on an HBO Comic Relief show. The moniker has stuck to a guy whos been part of the stand-up comedy scene for a long time.

programme.title: Ron Ruhman: Weird Stuff
programme.desc: Ron has been called a `High Energy Seinfeld. He brings a very energetic style to the stage as he shares his interesting slant on day-to-day life in an act that is clean, smart, and very entertaining.

programme.title: Geoff Norcott: Basic Bloke
programme.desc: Geoff is trying to unpick whats happening with your average bloke. Remember them.

programme.title: Lost Voice Guy: Im Only in it for Parking
programme.desc: A debut hour of cutting edge material combines the political and personal with razor-sharp observations about disability and daily life.

programme.title: Ken Rogerson: Way North of 40
programme.desc: Ken Rogerson started his comedy career working the Chicago club circuit and at the famed Second City.

programme.title: Josh Novey: Tickling Grizzlies
programme.desc: Josh uses his humour and easy-going stage presence to entertain.

programme.title: Matthew Jenkins: I Also Have Merch
programme.desc: Comedian Matthew Jenkins performs a set about the racism rampant in the UK today, the experience of childhood and his experience of going to a state penitentiary to earn his degree.

programme.desc: Comedian Matthew Jenkins performs a set about the racism rampant in the UK today, the experience of childhood and his experience of going to a state penitentiary to earn his degree.

programme.title: Glen Tickle: The Favorite
programme.desc: Glen Tickle apologises for his last name, explains the things only pro comedians have time for, and tells stories on stage.

programme.title: Jason Russell: Beige Frosty
programme.desc: Like most comedians, finding a way to be silly in class was a way to get attention from classmates.

programme.title: Joe Deuce: Mixed Reviews
programme.desc: Hailing from Kentucky and living the best of both worlds, Joe Deuce discusses his encounters with Amish police, real-time irony, and toilet paper personality tests.

programme.title: Bryan Miller: Panic Room
programme.desc: Bryan Miller sees past societys traps; the man cave is 1/16 control over the house that you own half of, birth control is just placing your cell phone in the right pocket, and a comma in an income check most likely indicates prosperity.

programme.title: James Gregory: Food is Not Fatal
programme.desc: James Gregory, a Georgian suffering from Vertigo, is on a mission to spread the good news of "real butter", Paul-bearing strength, hotter summers, and endangered chicken legs.

programme.title: JJ Barrows: Doodle All Day
programme.desc: JJs uses unique humour to navigate through the realities of life, being single through her thirties, and adjusting to life changes brought about by age and a cross country move.

programme.title: Karen Morgan: Go Dawgs!
programme.desc: A former trial attorney, Karen Morgan moved from the courtroom to comedy after being selected as a finalist on Nickelodeon TVs `Search for the Funniest Mom in America.

programme.title: Costaki Economopoulos: Now That Im A Grown Up
programme.desc: For 20 years Costaki has been living his dream as a full-time stand up comic.

programme.title: Maija DiGiorgio: Maija Pinion
programme.desc: In her comedy, Maija examines the complexities of being a multicultural woman in this stand-up special.

programme.title: Alex Velluto: Spurious
programme.desc: Like Rocky Balboa, Alex Velluto is the son of an Italian immigrant and brings the same intensity, will, and drive to the comedy stage.

programme.title: Ricky Glore: Dad Bod
programme.desc: Ricky Glore is a stand up comedian and comedy writer known for his high energy and confidence on stage. He has opened for some of the top comedians, including Tracy Morgan, Damon Wayans, and Doug Benson.

programme.title: Steve Hofstetter: A Trip to Japan
programme.desc: Steve Hoffstetter covers things from paper decapitations in plane crashes to seeing-eye children.

programme.title: Jason Hewlett: Im the Weird One
programme.desc: The award-winning one-man show of Jason Hewlett The Entertainer will have the viewer laughing until it hurts. Comedy, music, impressions, and standing ovations make Jason the perfect entertainer.

programme.title: Matthew Jenkins: I Also Have Merch
programme.desc: Comedian Matthew Jenkins performs a set about the racism rampant in the UK today, the experience of childhood and his experience of going to a state penitentiary to earn his degree.

programme.title: Moody McCarthy: The Good Jew
programme.desc: Comedian Moody McCarthy performs in front of a live audience.

programme.title: Kabir Singh: Retiring Material
programme.desc: Kabir Singhs style has an abundance of energy, an in-your-face attitude, and clever material.

programme.title: Zoltan Kaszas: Cat Jokes
programme.desc: Hungarian-born Zoltan Kaszas leans in about growing up in San Diego and slew of cat jokes in a stand-up special.

programme.title: Tommy Drake: Mouse
programme.desc: Since the early 90s, Tommy Drake has been a staple in the stand-up comedy world. Tommys unique mixture of original material delivered in a classic style has given him a wide set of opportunities.

programme.title: Chris Voth: Cashmere
programme.desc: Chris Voth is an accomplished comedian, a licensed teacher and a published author.

programme.title: Orlando Baxter: Glorified Baby Sitter

programme.title: Miles Jupp: Fibber in the Heat
programme.desc: Miles Jupp recounts the story of attempting fake it as a cricket journalist in India live in 2014.

programme.title: Tom Ryan: Off the Verge
programme.desc: Comedian Tom Ryan performs a standup show.

programme.title: Clayburn Cox: Toothbrush Prank War
programme.desc: Clayburn Cox performs a night of standup comedy with iconic Alabama wit and heckling.

programme.title: Daniel Eachus: A Mild And Skinny Guy
programme.desc: Daniel Eachus talks about weird jobs, strange fears and how to prank restaurants all through the lens of being the lifelong skinny guy.

programme.title: Hyde Panaser: Live at Angel Comedy
programme.desc: Hyde Panaser performs their brand of standup comedy at the Bill Murray in London.

programme.title: Nick Elleray: Live at Angel Comedy
programme.desc: Nick Elleray performs their brand of standup comedy at the Bill Murray in London.

programme.title: Andy Hendrickson: Left Field
programme.desc: Comedian Andy Hendrickson performs a standup show.

programme.title: Max and Ivan: Holmes and Watson
programme.desc: The worlds greatest detective tackles Chicagos murky underworld. A prohibition-era tale of revenge, whisky and javelins.

programme.title: Daren Streblow: Organic and Inorganic Life
programme.desc: Daren Streblows unique style of observational stand-up comedy has been entertaining hundreds-of-thousands of people throughout the United States and around the world since he first stepped on the stage in 1995.

programme.title: Max and Ivan - Our Story
programme.desc: Max and Ivan introduce the world to two never-before-seen characters; themselves.

programme.title: Ed Byrne: Crowd Pleaser
programme.desc: Live stand-up comedy from Irish comedian Ed Byrne, including his take on being a nerd, owning a cat, meeting his heroes, and becoming a dad.

programme.title: Maher Matta: Personally Speaking
programme.desc: Comedian Maher Matta has been performing stand-up comedy for nearly sixteen years. He has appeared on FOXs Laughs TV, has performed at comedy clubs across the country, hired for private events, and placed in comedy festivals and competitions.

programme.title: Tom Mayhew: I, Tom Mayhew
programme.desc: This is a story of rejections, the JobCentre, being working class, and fighting for your place in the world.

programme.title: Stewart Francis: Pun Gent
programme.desc: Stewart Francis is a master of the pun-demental art of the double entendre.

programme.title: Jake Farrell: Sky
programme.desc: Naïve suburbanite Jake Farrell answers questions about family, the future and Stevenage.

programme.title: Miles Jupp: Is the Chap Youre Thinking Of
programme.desc: Mild mannered Miles Jupp goes on a journey of middle class woes.

programme.title: Ben Van der Velde: Fablemaker
programme.desc: Ben Van der Velde raids the library of his fantastical imagination to create thrillers, romances, ghost stories and more original freewheeling tales thatve never been told before and never will be again.

programme.title: Jessica Fostekew: Silence of the Nans
programme.desc: Tales of a misguided gig on a cruise liner take centre stage in Fostekews re-telling of this epic holiday-horror story, which is based on real events.

programme.title: The Gorgeous Diva: Songs in the Key of Me
programme.desc: The Gorgeous Diva has yet another shot at fame in this glorious performance featuring songs and anecdotes in front of her adoring fan.

programme.desc: When the family goes to Granny and Grandpa Pigs house for dinner, George is reluctant to eat his salad.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and Rebecca Rabbit pretend to be babies to get Mummy Rabbits attention. Mummy Rabbit plays along until they admit they are not really babies!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa is on a play date with Candy Cat at Mr Cats Cafe. Candy show Mr Cat the drawings theyve done of everyone, and he hangs them up for everyone to see.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: On a cold day, Daddy Pig suggests they build a den until Mummy Pig has finished work. After a hard days work, the cushion den is a perfect place to watch TV together!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her friends go on a camping trip with their teacher, Madame Gazelle. After pitching their tents and collecting sticks, they all sing a song around the campfire.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family borrow Grandpa Pigs boat and head out for a day on the river. All is going well until the boat gets stuck in some long reeds - Daddy Pig to the rescue.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: When a power cut plunges their house into darkness, Peppa and George have fun looking for a torch and thinking of games to play in the dark.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are playing in the garden with their bouncy ball when Suzy Sheep turns up with two tennis rackets. She uses the bouncy ball to play a game of tennis with Peppa, making George feel left out. Will the job of ball boy cheer him up?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy and Daddy Pig let Peppa and George put their coats on over their pyjamas and go outside to look at the stars. With the help of a telescope, Daddy Pig teaches Peppa and George how to find the North Star.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its Daddy Pigs birthday, but he has to go to work, so while hes away, Mummy Pig, Peppa and George prepare a special birthday surprise.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: When Peppa goes for a sleepover at Zoe Zebras house with Suzy Sheep, Rebecca Rabbit, Candy Cat and Emily Elephant, the girls are too excited to go to sleep.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family win a trip to America to star in Super Potatos movie, `Vegetables in Space. Miss Rabbit flies them over and they land in New York only to meet a new Miss Rabbit who shows them around the city of New York. They go up the Empire State Building and see the lights in Times Square. Now they have to get to Hollywood.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and family are driving in their large campervan across America to get to Hollywood. They stop at a diner to ask for directions and meet another Miss Rabbit. She sings them some songs and cooks them some eggs, over easy, of course, then they go to a barn dance followed closely by watching a Monster Truck rally, expect lots of muddy puddles.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and family continue driving across America to get to Hollywood. As they drive through the desert, they meet Mr. Buffalo and Mr. Bison who are doing road work just like Mr. Bull from back home. They meet another Miss Rabbit and fly over the Grand Canyon in a helicopter, white water raft through the rapids and discover a cave from 700AD.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and family make it to Hollywood, but they need to find the movie studio where Super Potato and Hash Brown are making the film `Vegetables in Space. They get lost on the freeway, but another Miss Rabbit tells them to follow the stars, which turn out to be stars in the pavement.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: At playgroup, Madame Gazelle teaches Peppa and friends how to exercise with hoops, or hulahoop. Peppa takes her hoop home and teaches Mummy and Daddy how to use it.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy, Daddy, Peppa and George go to the park where they meet their friends, swing on the monkey bars, and bounce on a bouncy branch. They then end with jumping in lots of muddy puddles.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Pig shows Peppa how to play pretend by teaching her how to wink. Zoe Zebra comes to play with Peppa and brings along her toy monkey. Peppa pretends Monkey has a cough.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Police Officer Panda and Police Officer Squirrel visit Peppas playgroup. They offer two lucky children the chance to spend the day with them.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her friends play some very active games in the garden and together they learn to hop, skip and jump.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Miss Rabbits Rescue Service has saved many people from tricky situations, but what happens when Miss Rabbit needs rescuing herself.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa learns that Mummy Pig used to keep a diary when she was her age, so Peppa decides to give it a try.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George and Peppa spend the day playing golf with Grandpa Pig, but they are much more interested in the colourful minigolf course next door.

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.desc: Peppa and family are watching TV... until it breaks! While Grampy Rabbit fixes it, the family get a new TV which can do everything... but it doesnt beat their old TV.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: A storm cancels Peppa and her familys adventure plans so they decide to take it inside. Using their imagination, they go sledding, climb a mountain and have a campfire in the attic.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are playing in their pool. They help the garden animals cool down but when it rains, the animals are happy and so is Peppa. Rain makes muddy puddles for jumping in!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are in Granny and Grandpa Pigs Garden. Grannys friends are playing folk music! They play music for Grandpa Pig and then Grandpa Pig makes apple juice for everyone!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: It is bedtime and Peppa calls Kylie Kangaroo and is surprised to learn that it is not morning or winter where she is! Daddy Pig explains this using a big ball to represent the Earth.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: While visiting Suzy and Emilys house, Peppa is surprised that there are extra rules which she does not have in her own house. On the drive home, Peppa explains to Mummy Pig that different houses have different rules.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Pig is confirming she is having a new baby. Mummy and Daddy Pig share the exciting news with Peppa and her brother, George.

programme.desc: When Peppa and Suzy learn that grown ups must work all day, they decide to play at working in a shop. They quickly find it is very tiring.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family spot a rainbow when they go for a drive.

programme.title: Crank
programme.desc: An ex-hit man is injected with a mysterious cocktail of drugs by his arch-rival that will kill him if his heart rate drops below a certain level. Hurtling through a succession of sex and violence in order to keep his pulse rate up, he must seek revenge and keep himself and his girlfriend alive.

programme.title: Twilight of the Warriors: Walled In
programme.desc: The notorious Kowloon Walled City serves as a fortified, lawless safe haven for gangs and refugees alike. But when a skilled underground fighter runs afoul of the most feared Triad boss in Hong Kong.

programme.title: American Night
programme.desc: An art dealer and a ruthless New York mafia boss fight for money, power and love.

programme.title: Seeking Justice
programme.desc: Quiet teacher Will Gerard is sucked into a world of vigilantism when his wife Laura is brutally attacked.

programme.title: Seeking Justice
programme.desc: Quiet teacher Will Gerard is sucked into a world of vigilantism when his wife Laura is brutally attacked.

programme.title: LEGO DC Comics Super Heroes: Justice League vs. Bizarro League
programme.desc: Superman, Batman and the rest of the Justice League team up with the Bizarro League to defeat Darkseid.

programme.title: Curious George
programme.desc: Curious George is an inquisitive little monkey with an insatiable taste for adventure. Georges fun-loving enthusiastic nature endears him to new friends, but also lands him in a series of misadventures.

programme.title: Tom and Jerry: Cowboy Up!
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry are in the Wild West where they help save a ranch from the hands of a greedy villain. The rivals team up to help a cowgirl and her brother save their homestead from a greedy land-grabber.

programme.title: Madagascar
programme.desc: Spoiled by their upbringing and with no idea of what wildlife is really like, Alex the lion, Marty the zebra and hypochondriac giraffe Melman swap New York Central Zoo for madcap Madagascar, on a journey to find their friend.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: Dracula, who operates a high-end resort away from the human world, goes into overprotective mode when a boy discovers the resort and falls for the counts teen-aged daughter.

programme.title: Despicable Me 4
programme.desc: Gru welcomes a new member to the family, Gru Jr., whos intent on tormenting his dad. However, their peaceful existence soon comes crashing down when criminal mastermind Maxime Le Mal escapes from prison and vows revenge against Gru.

programme.title: The Boss Baby
programme.desc: A wildly imaginative seven-year-old boy discovers that his new brother, Boss Baby, is actually a spy on a secret mission, and only he can help thwart a dastardly plot that involves an epic battle between puppies and babies.

programme.title: Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa
programme.desc: The sequel to `Madagascar, in which New York Zoo animals, Alex the Lion, Marty the Zebra, Melman the Giraffe and Gloria the Hippo, still stranded on Madagascar, start to leave the island. All of a sudden, they land in the wilderness of Africa, where Alex meets the rest of his family, but has trouble communicating with them after spending so much time at the Central Park Zoo.

programme.title: Small Foot
programme.desc: Migo is a friendly Yeti who discovers something that he didnt know existed: a human. When his fellow villagers refuse to believe him, Migo embarks on an epic journey to find the mysterious creature that can put him back in good graces.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 2
programme.desc: Concerned that his half-human grandson isnt showing his vampire side, Dracula and his friends put the boy through a `monster-in-training boot camp just as Dracs old-school father decides to pay a visit.

programme.title: Over the Hedge
programme.desc: An opportunistic raccoon teaches fellow animals about the edible treasures that the new humans in the neighbourhood conveniently leave outdoors.

programme.title: Turbo
programme.desc: A snail gets the chance to escape his slow-paced life and race in the Indianapolis 500 when a freak accident gives him the power of superspeed.

programme.title: Rugrats in Paris: The Movie
programme.desc: The Rugrats are in Paris where Chuckies widowed father has been called on to mend an animated monster in a theme park, but its all a ploy by Coco LaBouche - the parks head, to get appointed head of a major company. As she and her henchman Jean-Claude plan to ensnare him, only the rest of the Rugrats can stop him falling for her charms.

programme.title: Barnyard
programme.desc: Otis the cow is a wild-living party animal and just loves to dance until dawn, but then his dad is killed by coyotes, and Otis has to become the responsible leader of the rest of the all-singing, all-dancing farm animals.

programme.title: The Road to El Dorado
programme.desc: Two rogues stumble across a map of the treasures of El Dorado and stow away on an explorers ship bound for South America, where they are mistaken for gods due to their foreign complexions. Narrated by Elton John, who provided the music to Tim Rices lyrics.

programme.title: The Wild Thornberrys Movie
programme.desc: A feature-length spin-off from the TV series, the Thornberry family - led by natural history film-maker Colonel Radcliff Thornberry - head to deepest Africa. Once there, daughter Eliza - after meeting a shaman - can talk to the animals, a skill that stands her in good stead to foil a dastardly plot by poachers to kill a herd of elephants for their ivory.

programme.title: The Wild Thornberrys Movie
programme.desc: A feature-length spin-off from the TV series, the Thornberry family - led by natural history film-maker Colonel Radcliff Thornberry - head to deepest Africa. Once there, daughter Eliza - after meeting a shaman - can talk to the animals, a skill that stands her in good stead to foil a dastardly plot by poachers to kill a herd of elephants for their ivory.

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview
programme.desc: Previews of the great films now playing on Sky Cinema plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: David Brent: Life on the Road
programme.desc: David Brent is on tour with his band `Forgone Conclusion. However, tickets sales are not enough to keep the band afloat so Brent has to dip into his pension. Meanwhile, he is being filmed for what he believes will be a documentary, like Martin Scorsese did with The Rolling Stones, but it if for a `where are they now style documentary.

programme.title: Housesitter
programme.desc: Newton Davis builds a dream home for his childhood sweetheart and is promptly dumped. Devastated, he seeks solace in the arms of a waitress, but sneaks off into the night once hes had his fun. The spurned waitress exacts her revenge by moving into the empty house and masquerading as Newtons wife. At this stage, things start getting complicated.

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
programme.desc: Scott Pilgrim plays bass guitar in a struggling Toronto-based band and pines after his ex-girlfriend, now a success in her own band. At a party he meets Ramona Flowers and instantly is smitten, but in his pursuit of her he is attacked by Matthew Patel who informs Scott that he is the first of seven evil exes that Scott will have to defeat in order to win Ramona.

programme.title: The Holdovers
programme.desc: Forced to spend Christmas break with a handful of students, a curmudgeonly instructor at a New England prep school develops an unlikely bond with a brainy troublemaker and the head cook.

programme.title: Nutty Professor II: The Klumps
programme.desc: Sherman is getting married to Denise Gains but his alter-ego Buddy Love keeps breaking through. Determined to rid himself of his pesky partner, he extracts Buddys genes, but an accident and a dog hair see Buddy take on his own life. Unaware of his existence, Sherman and Denise perfect their new rejuvenation formula and their fortune seems assured until Buddy steals it.

programme.title: Ted
programme.desc: When John Bennett was a little boy, he made a wish that Ted, his beloved teddy bear, would come alive. Thirty years later, foul-mouthed Ted is still Johns constant companion, much to the chagrin of Lori, Johns girlfriend. Though Loris displeasure is exacerbated by the pairs constant consumption of beer and weed, shes not the one whos most disappointed with John; it may take the intervention of Johns boyhood toy to help him grow up at last.

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: Teddy bear Ted seeks legal help from a young lawyer and a legendary, civil-rights attorney when the law declares him to be property and not a person.

programme.title: The Hangover
programme.desc: A crazy Las Vegas bachelor party turns into a race against time when three hung-over groomsmen awaken after a night of drunken debauchery to find that the groom has gone missing, and attempt to get him to the alter in time for his wedding.

programme.title: The Hangover Part II
programme.desc: A group of friends go to Thailand for a quiet and restrained stag party, but are dismayed to wake up in a mysterious hotel room, with a man missing and no memory of the night before. Of course, Alan manages to get himself in with the crowd.

programme.title: The Hangover Part III
programme.desc: Phil, Stu and Doug take Alan on a road trip to help him through a personal crisis.

programme.title: Love Actually
programme.desc: Weaving in and out of the love lives of eight loosely inter-related couples. The bachelor Prime Minister falls for his personal assistant, his brother-in-law is flirting with one of his colleagues, a writer heads off to France and pursues an affair with a maid, and an 11-year-old boy asks his father for advice on matters of the heart.

programme.title: Kangaroo Jack
programme.desc: Two childhood friends get caught up in with the mob in New York and find themselves forced to travel to Australia to deliver $50,000. Their trouble really starts when they reach the outback, and a kangaroo bounds away with the cash.

programme.title: Parenthood
programme.desc: An over-protective dad, determined to do a better job than his own distant father, anxiously dotes on his troubled eight-year-old son. His brother, meanwhile, strives to mould his toddler daughter into an academic high-flyer, and his sister struggles with two rebellious, angst-ridden teenagers.

programme.title: Parenthood
programme.desc: An over-protective dad, determined to do a better job than his own distant father, anxiously dotes on his troubled eight-year-old son. His brother, meanwhile, strives to mould his toddler daughter into an academic high-flyer, and his sister struggles with two rebellious, angst-ridden teenagers.

programme.title: Fifty Shades of Grey
programme.desc: An inexperienced student begins a daring affair with a controlling businessman whose sexual proclivities push the boundaries of pain and pleasure.

programme.title: The Boy in the Striped Pyjamas
programme.desc: When his fathers job results in a family move to the countryside, young German boy Bruno misses his old friends. Roaming the grounds of the large country house he now calls home, he discovers the huge fenced facility that his dad Ralf, a Nazi officer, now manages. Approaching it, Bruno meets Shmuel, a fellow youngster on the other side of the barbed wire, wearing what appears to be a pair of pyjamas.

programme.title: Elizabeth: The Golden Age
programme.desc: Elizabeth might have her royal rival Mary Queen of Scots in custody, but a far greater threat lies to the east: the Spanish Armada. Despite her reign of 30 years, Elizabeths hold on the English throne remains uncertain. Her kingdom lies in the shadow of mighty Spain, Philip IIs vast army and the Inquisition, but Elizabeth is undaunted.

programme.title: A League of Their Own
programme.desc: Based on a true story, this film, set during World War II, tells the story of the all-female baseball league that was started while the American men were away fighting in Europe. After a team of potential players has been recruited, former player Jimmy Dugan coaches the girls and prepares them for the World Series.

programme.title: Sleepless in Seattle
programme.desc: A recently engaged woman becomes obsessed with meeting the grieving widower she heard on a late night radio show. Sam, the widower, receives hundreds of letters following the radio phone-in which was instigated by his son Jonah.

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: Germany advances into France, trapping Allied troops on the beaches of Dunkirk. Under air and ground cover from British and French forces, troops are slowly and methodically evacuated from the beach using every vessel that can be found.

programme.title: There Will Be Blood
programme.desc: Ruthless silver miner, turned oil prospector, Daniel Plainview moves to oil-rich California. Using his adopted son HW to project a trustworthy, family-man image, Plainview cons local landowners into selling him their valuable properties for a pittance. However, local preacher Eli Sunday suspects Plainviews motives and intentions, starting a slow-burning feud that threatens both their lives.

programme.title: One Life
programme.desc: The story of British humanitarian Nicholas Winton, who helped save hundreds of predominantly Jewish children from the Nazis on the eve of World War II.

programme.title: Bob Marley: One Love
programme.desc: Jamaican singer-songwriter Bob Marley overcomes adversity to become the most famous reggae musician in the world.

programme.title: Dreamgirls
programme.desc: Following the adventures of The Dreamettes, an all-girl singing group. Theyre going nowhere fast until they meet fast-talking car salesman-come-manager who has ambitions to make a fortune selling black music to a white audience. He persuades them to become backing singers for James `Thunder Early, but the larger-than-life lead singer Effie White must step out of the spotlight in favour of the more image-friendly Deena Jones.

programme.title: The Holiday
programme.desc: Dumped and depressed, English rose Iris agrees to swap homes with similarly unlucky in love Californian Amanda for a much-needed break. Iris finds herself in a palatial Hollywood mansion while Amanda navigates the lanes of a picture-perfect English village. Soon enough, both lovelorn ladies bump into local lads perfect for a romantic pick-me-up.

programme.title: Fifty Shades Darker
programme.desc: Shadowy figures from Christian Greys past threaten to destroy his rekindled romance with Anastasia Steele.

programme.title: Fifty Shades Darker
programme.desc: Shadowy figures from Christian Greys past threaten to destroy his rekindled romance with Anastasia Steele.

programme.title: Friend or Foe
programme.desc: WWII evacuee David hates the Germans, but now his life has been saved by one. What is the right thing to do, tell the Army or offer his help?

programme.title: Finding Neverland
programme.desc: Its London in 1904, and writer JM Barrie is inspired by a family he meets, mother Sylvia and her four children, Peter, Jack, George and Michael. From the time he spends with them, he writes the famous childrens novel `Peter Pan.

programme.title: Big Fat Liar
programme.desc: A junior high-school student and his best friend play a series of pranks on the sleazy Hollywood producer responsible for plagiarising his class essay and turning it into a hit film.

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire
programme.desc: The Spenglers return to the New York City firehouse where the original Ghostbusters have taken ghost-busting to the next level. When the discovery of an ancient artefact unleashes an evil force, Ghostbusters new and old must unite to save the world.

programme.title: Look Whos Talking Too
programme.desc: A wisecracking toddler deals with toilet training, bickering parents and a baby sister in this sequel to the 1989 hit.

programme.title: The Huntsman: Winters War
programme.desc: A huntsman and a fellow warrior help an ice queen battle the evil sister who betrayed her.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out of the Shadows
programme.desc: The turtles spring into action to battle Shredder, mad scientist Baxter Stockman, Bebop, Rocksteady and the notorious Krang.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: Four unlikely warriors rise from the sewers and join forces with fearless reporter April ONeil to save New York from Shredder and his evil minions.

programme.title: The Nutty Professor
programme.desc: Professor Sherman, a 450lb scientist, falls for his new colleague Professor Carla Purty, but out on a date, hes humiliated by a nightclub comedian about his weight. Upset and depressed, he takes a potion hes only tested previously on hamsters and - hey presto - he turns into a svelte and cool-talking babe-magnet, Buddy Love.

programme.title: Nutty Professor II: The Klumps
programme.desc: Sherman is getting married to Denise Gains but his alter-ego Buddy Love keeps breaking through. Determined to rid himself of his pesky partner, he extracts Buddys genes, but an accident and a dog hair see Buddy take on his own life. Unaware of his existence, Sherman and Denise perfect their new rejuvenation formula and their fortune seems assured until Buddy steals it.

programme.title: Look Whos Talking Now
programme.desc: In the third of the `Look Whos Talking comedies, two dogs enter the Umbriacco household - and take an immediate dislike to each other. When Molly loses her job, husband James is forced to take on a demanding role as private airline pilot. The children miss him, so he buys a dog to cheer them up. However, when Jamess glamorous boss asks his family to look after her poodle, sparks fly between the dogs.

programme.title: Big Fat Liar
programme.desc: A junior high-school student and his best friend play a series of pranks on the sleazy Hollywood producer responsible for plagiarising his class essay and turning it into a hit film.

programme.title: Pups United
programme.desc: A group of talking dogs save the Youth World Cup football finals.

programme.title: The Wiz
programme.desc: In this version of the classic story - based on the smash Broadway musical - Dorothy is a shy 24-year-old Harlem kindergarten teacher who is brought by a snowstorm to the mysterious Land of Oz, a sprawling, decaying, nightmarish, and dangerous megalopolis that resembles the physical characteristics of New York City.

programme.title: The Wiz
programme.desc: In this version of the classic story - based on the smash Broadway musical - Dorothy is a shy 24-year-old Harlem kindergarten teacher who is brought by a snowstorm to the mysterious Land of Oz, a sprawling, decaying, nightmarish, and dangerous megalopolis that resembles the physical characteristics of New York City.

programme.title: Men in Black 3
programme.desc: Agent J goes back to the swinging 60s in a time-travelling mission to save his partner from a murderous alien.

programme.title: Cinema List: Thrilling Thriller
programme.desc: Send your heart racing with these masterful thrillers creating tension so thick you could cut it, from 70s hit `The China Syndrome to M Night Shyamalans 2024 blockbuster `Trap.

programme.title: Men in Black
programme.desc: The secretive Men in Black are agents charged with regulating the aliens who have settled on Earth and ensure that they remain undetected. New recruit J and his partner K must find and stop an intergalactic terrorist bent on assassinating two ambassadors from opposing galaxies before they can make peace.

programme.title: Men in Black II
programme.desc: Sequel to the sci-fi comedy about a top secret government task force set up to deal with unruly extraterrestrials. An MIB agent turns to the only man who can help him save the world from a rampaging, shape-shifting alien which has taken on the outward appearance of a sexy lingerie model.

programme.desc: Bridgets brand new relationship with Darcy has taken a plummet due to her jealousy of his workmate. programme.title: Bridget Joness Baby
programme.desc: Befuddled mom-to-be Bridget Jones must figure out which of the two men in her life is the father of her child.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Saturday Night
programme.desc: To celebrate the release of the film Saturday Night, join the Cinema List as we explore 50 years of hilarious films from the SNL cast - including Waynes World, Bridesmaids and more.

programme.title: Bridget Jones: Mad About the Boy
programme.desc: After jumping back into the dating pool, single mother Bridget Jones finds herself caught between a younger man and her sons science teacher.

programme.title: Spin the Bottle
programme.desc: When a group of friends play spin the bottle in a house marked by a brutal massacre, they unknowingly unleash an evil spirit and start dying in terrifying ways. The survivors must stick together to uncover the houses secrets and end the bloodshed.

programme.title: Die Alone
programme.desc: A young man with amnesia bands together with a rugged survivalist after a devastating virus causes a zombie-like outbreak.

programme.title: Wish You Were Here
programme.desc: When a perfect night with a perfect stranger ends suddenly the next morning, Charlotte searches for answers and meaning in her life. However, she soon uncovers a shocking secret that changes everything she knows about the man who captured her heart.

programme.title: Code 3
programme.desc: On his final 24-hour shift, a burned-out paramedic is tasked with training his eager but inexperienced replacement. What starts as a routine night quickly spirals into a chaotic odyssey that tests their endurance, instincts and sense of humour.

programme.title: It Feeds
programme.desc: A clairvoyant therapist confronts her own personal demons while trying to save a young girl who believes a malevolent entity is feeding on her.

programme.desc: After jumping back into the dating pool, single mother Bridget Jones finds herself caught between a younger man and her sons science teacher.

programme.title: Wolf Man
programme.desc: Attacked by an unseen animal, Blake and his family barricade themselves inside a farmhouse as the creature prowls the perimeter. As the night stretches on, however, he begins to behave strangely, transforming into something unrecognizable.

programme.title: Novocaine
programme.desc: When the girl of his dreams gets kidnapped, a man turns his inability to feel pain into an unexpected advantage as he fights a bunch of thugs to get her back.

programme.desc: Hapless Agnes repeatedly falls for the wrong guy, dies a grim death, and is reincarnated a century later. As she experiences romantic misfortune through different eras of history, Agnes seeks to avoid repeat mistakes and finally break the cycle.

programme.channel: Sky Cinema Sci Fi and Horror HD.uk
programme.title: Restore Point
programme.desc: In 2041 central Europe, Detective Em investigates the case of a murdered couple where a restoration team brings one of them back to life.

programme.title: Kill

programme.desc: Pat Martin is in the frozen tundra of Minnesota to visit his new friend, Chef Yia Vang. They brave the cold and break nearly-frozen ground to barbecue a pigs head in the earth.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: As one of the cheapest members of the produce aisle, bananas will save you bunches of money when you whip up these delightfully appealing recipes that go above and beyond a basic bread.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Frankie takes on his longtime frenemy, the onion, and all its powerful relatives. There might be a few tears shed along the way, but they are well worth the delicious and flavorful results, from sweet buttery leeks to the ultimate onion masterpiece.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Frankie is all about BYOL - bring your own lunch. Its not only good for your wallet, its good for your health. Skip the vending machine and the cafeteria in favor of creative, cost effective and easy-to-transport midday meals.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Amp up your salad game with a little mixing and matching, from light and leafy greens to crisp and hearty toppings, and dressings for all occasions. Frankie shows us how versatile and fulfilling a homemade salad can truly be.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.sub-title: How Do You Like Them Apples
programme.desc: Apples arent just good for keeping the doctor away. Frankie demonstrates how to make the most of this beloved, everyday fruit, from sweet treats to savory meals. Theres a whole world of apples to dive into, especially while theyre in season.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: The air is crisp and the leaves are changing, which means its time to gather round the dinner table for hearty, seasonal meals on a budget. These warm dishes are sure to keep you cozy all season long.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Who knew mayo could be such a savvy secret agent? Its a controversial condiment that can unlock the buttery, crispy, decadent codes of our favorite dishes, without leaving a trace of mayo-ness. Best of all, its easy to make at home!

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.sub-title: I Need To Eat Right Now
programme.desc: At the end of a long, hectic day, when you need dinner in a pinch, Frankie unlocks his not-so-secret formula for whipping up quick and easy meals, using minimal ingredients that will satisfy your cravings and feed the family in a flash.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: At a loss when your pantry is empty? With these recipes, you can walk into any grocery store with only $7 and walk out with everything you need for an entire meal. Because yes, you can whip up a nutritious meal at an affordable price!

programme.title: Struggle Meals

programme.desc: Pati experiences the Escaramuza- An all-female horse riding and skills competition. In the kitchen, Pati makes Jalisco-style birria and her friend, pastry chef and cookbook author Fany Gerson, joins her to make gelatinas for dessert.

programme.title: Patis Mexican Table
programme.desc: Gualberto "Weber" Elizondo surprised his family when his grilling hobby turned him into a local celebrity and internet sensation. Meanwhile, chef Chuy Villareal of Cara De Vaca wants the world to know that the north of Mexico isnt just carne asada.

programme.title: Patis Mexican Table
programme.desc: Two sisters made a little shack on the Rio Ramos into a must-visit restaurant known for one dish: cortadillo stew. Down the road, another restaurant uses traditional stews in their famous empalmes.

programme.title: Patis Mexican Table
programme.desc: Nuevo Leon is divided between two pro soccer teams: Los Tigres and Los Rayados. Pati tries the food at each stadium with the teams stars to determine who wins in the battle of tortas vs tacos.

programme.title: Patis Mexican Table
programme.desc: Irving Quiroz wrote the book on Mexican bread. Pati visits his workshop for his secret to making the perfect campechana, then meets Chuy Elizondo, owner of one of the hottest brunch spots in town.

programme.title: Patis Mexican Table
programme.desc: The Garza family invites Pati to their vineyard to help the community make piloncillo - and its hard work! Then, in the magic town of Bustamante, three sisters make traditional bread in adobe ovens.

programme.title: Patis Mexican Table
programme.desc: Gaby Molinar owns Huerto Urbano, an urban farm dedicated to providing Monterrey with nutritious, diverse local ingredients. And her husband is one of the regions greatest culinary pioneers.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Wild Boar Feast: Chorizo with Mussels and Whole Roasted Leg
programme.desc: Wild boar takes center stage! Andrew makes chorizo with mussels, preserved lemon and white wine. Then, he slow-roasts a whole leg over fire, served Southern-style with pickled cherries, glazed onions and mustard sauce.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Elk Tenderloin Tostadas and Grilled Rack of Ribs
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern highlights lean elk, first crafting classic Mexican tostadas with grilled tenderloin, avocado, and homemade salsa macha. Then, he grills a whole rack of elk, serving it with creamy colcannon, tarragon emulsion, and rosemary charcoal.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Creamy Clam Chowder and Mussels in Spicy Tomato Sauce
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern demystifies cooking clams, mussels and oysters.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern reimagines the Hawaiian plate lunch with a hand chopped venison burger topped with homemade gravy and a fried egg, jumbo grilled shrimp, a humble macaroni salad and a heaping scoop of white rice.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Venison Paillard and Hearty Hunters Stew
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern showcases venison two ways: a delicate grilled paillard with artichokes and parmesan, and a rich, slow-braised Polish hunters stew with kielbasa, mushrooms, and sauerkraut. Served with grilled leeks and coal-roasted potatoes.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern prepares the ultimate shore lunch of fried walleye filets, served with a tangy homemade tartar sauce, coleslaw, and crispy fried potatoes. Next, chef grills bone-in elk chops with a simple mustard glaze over hardwood charcoal.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern grills his favorite tender cuts of venison and serves it with coal-roasted sweet potatoes. Then, he cooks a hearty pot of classic Louisiana gumbo using wild duck and grills crispy-skinned duck breast for the topping.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Southern Shrimp Skewers and Asian Crispy Rice
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern grills beloved shrimp in two distinct ways. He starts with jumbo shrimp and country ham skewers glazed with sweet-hot pepper jelly. Then, he creates Asian-inspired shrimp, served over crispy battle rice and a complex sambal.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern shares his favorite way to prepare wild turkey breast, pan-fried over an open fire. Served with cheese sauce and jalapeno-bacon wild rice. Then, cooks a simple meal of seared salmon and a side of crispy potatoes and onions.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Mediterranean Grilled Filets and Salt Crusted Halibut
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern elevates California halibut, first with grilled fillets on saffron labneh with romesco and roasted cabbage. Then, he demonstrates a classic salt-crusted whole halibut, served with whole roasted cauliflower and a rich cream sauce.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Poultry Perfection: Moroccan Spiced Guinea Hen with Charred Vegetables
programme.desc: Andrew unlocks the rich flavor of guinea hen with a vibrant grilled salad featuring watercress and a mustard-hazelnut vinaigrette. Then, he slow-roasts a whole bird with Middle Eastern spices, served with harissa squash and eggplant-tahini puree.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Zimmern cooks his version of Peking-style goose. Next, Chef Zimmern cooks a meal of striped bass.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern grills his favorite tender cuts of venison and serves it with coal-roasted sweet potatoes. Then, he cooks a hearty pot of classic Louisiana gumbo using wild duck and grills crispy-skinned duck breast for the topping.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Southern Shrimp Skewers and Asian Crispy Rice
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern grills beloved shrimp in two distinct ways. He starts with jumbo shrimp and country ham skewers glazed with sweet-hot pepper jelly. Then, he creates Asian-inspired shrimp, served over crispy battle rice and a complex sambal.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern shares his favorite way to prepare wild turkey breast, pan-fried over an open fire. Served with cheese sauce and jalapeno-bacon wild rice. Then, cooks a simple meal of seared salmon and a side of crispy potatoes and onions.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Mediterranean Grilled Filets and Salt Crusted Halibut
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern elevates California halibut, first with grilled fillets on saffron labneh with romesco and roasted cabbage. Then, he demonstrates a classic salt-crusted whole halibut, served with whole roasted cauliflower and a rich cream sauce.

programme.sub-title: Poultry Perfection: Moroccan Spiced Guinea Hen with Charred Vegetables

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Zimmern cooks his version of Peking-style goose. Next, Chef Zimmern cooks a meal of striped bass.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern grills his favorite tender cuts of venison and serves it with coal-roasted sweet potatoes. Then, he cooks a hearty pot of classic Louisiana gumbo using wild duck and grills crispy-skinned duck breast for the topping.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Southern Shrimp Skewers and Asian Crispy Rice
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern grills beloved shrimp in two distinct ways. He starts with jumbo shrimp and country ham skewers glazed with sweet-hot pepper jelly. Then, he creates Asian-inspired shrimp, served over crispy battle rice and a complex sambal.

programme.title: Patis Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati learns about the history, the instruments, and the meaning behind Mariachi music . Pati makes carne en su jugo, tres chiles guacamole, and masa berry shortcake.

programme.title: Patis Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati experiences the Escaramuza- An all-female horse riding and skills competition. In the kitchen, Pati makes Jalisco-style birria and her friend, pastry chef and cookbook author Fany Gerson, joins her to make gelatinas for dessert.

programme.title: Patis Mexican Table
programme.desc: Gualberto "Weber" Elizondo surprised his family when his grilling hobby turned him into a local celebrity and internet sensation. Meanwhile, chef Chuy Villareal of Cara De Vaca wants the world to know that the north of Mexico isnt just carne asada.

programme.title: Patis Mexican Table
programme.desc: Two sisters made a little shack on the Rio Ramos into a must-visit restaurant known for one dish: cortadillo stew. Down the road, another restaurant uses traditional stews in their famous empalmes.

programme.title: Patis Mexican Table
programme.desc: Nuevo Leon is divided between two pro soccer teams: Los Tigres and Los Rayados. Pati tries the food at each stadium with the teams stars to determine who wins in the battle of tortas vs tacos.

programme.title: Patis Mexican Table
programme.desc: Irving Quiroz wrote the book on Mexican bread. Pati visits his workshop for his secret to making the perfect campechana, then meets Chuy Elizondo, owner of one of the hottest brunch spots in town.

programme.title: Patis Mexican Table
programme.desc: The Garza family invites Pati to their vineyard to help the community make piloncillo - and its hard work! Then, in the magic town of Bustamante, three sisters make traditional bread in adobe ovens.

programme.title: Patis Mexican Table
programme.desc: Gaby Molinar owns Huerto Urbano, an urban farm dedicated to providing Monterrey with nutritious, diverse local ingredients. And her husband is one of the regions greatest culinary pioneers.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Wild Boar Feast: Chorizo with Mussels and Whole Roasted Leg
programme.desc: Wild boar takes center stage! Andrew makes chorizo with mussels, preserved lemon and white wine. Then, he slow-roasts a whole leg over fire, served Southern-style with pickled cherries, glazed onions and mustard sauce.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Elk Tenderloin Tostadas and Grilled Rack of Ribs
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern highlights lean elk, first crafting classic Mexican tostadas with grilled tenderloin, avocado, and homemade salsa macha. Then, he grills a whole rack of elk, serving it with creamy colcannon, tarragon emulsion, and rosemary charcoal.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.sub-title: Wok Cooking On A Charcoal Grill
programme.desc: Anything is possible with a wok and a good ol charcoal grill, at least if youre Chef Dale, who throws together a heavenly spread of fiery eats, from drunken meats, stir fried veggies, and stir fried noodles.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Chef Dale Talde brings the heat when it comes to making perfect pork dishes including a root beer glazed pork banh mi, chorizo fried rice, Filipino sausage stuffed long hot peppers, and round it all out with a spicy grilled pineapple sundae.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Chef Dale Talde is throwin down a pizza spread like never before with his Chicago-style tavern pie with sausage and onion, a grilled pizza pocket with pepperoni and cheese, chicken wings a la pizzaiola, and a zesty grilled caesar salad to finish it off.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Its Pizza Time! Chef Dale Talde grills up amazing pizzas for every palate including a Detroit Style Pie, a Cheddar Naan Pie with a Spiced Chick Peas and Potatoes, and gives your childhood favorite French Bread Pizza a much needed upgrade.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Chef Dale Talde grills up summer favorites perfect for any backyard BBQ. Cheddar beer brats in a pretzel bun, BBQ lamb ribs with Chinese mustard sauce, watermelon lime soju punch, and warm donuts with grilled strawberries and whipped cream for dessert.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Summertime seasonal fruit pampers your tastebuds. Chef Dale grills blistered grapes with ham wrapped Trout, Peaches with smoked Pork Chops, Watermelon with halloumi, and Chargrilled Cherries with chocolate Mousse.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.sub-title: Sausage Egg and Cheese All Day Long
programme.desc: Chef Dale Talde brings out the best of brunch with sweet and savory hits such as Bacon Wrapped Dates Stuffed with Chorizo, Maple Sausage, Egg, and Cheese Fried Rice, and the tastiest BBQ Duck, Egg, and Corn Scallion Pancake Sandwiches youve ever eaten.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Ribs are a lifestyle, and Chef Dales living it up with smoky beef shorties in tangy red wine glaze, Miami-style pork ribs dripping in bacon-guava BBQ, spicy baked beans, and killer key lime caramel cones. Grab some napkins!

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Chef Dale Talde kicks the summer off right with a burger blowout featuring Brisket Burgers with Grilled Onions and Blue Cheese, Shrimp Burgers with XO Sauce and a Fried Egg, and Lamb Sliders with Feta Ranch and dont forget the Lemon Oregano Fries.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Chef Dale Talde tries his hand at hibachi by making supreme fried rice with shrimp, chicken, and bacon, pretzel pork dumplings, mushroom noodles, a filet of beef with the famous onion volcano, and washes it down with a melon and mint sake slushy.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsays Road Trip
programme.desc: On a mission to taste the worlds best breakfast, the three big egos Gordon, Gino and Fred are venturing out of their comfort zones crossing over the USA boarder into Mexico. They hope to stay out of trouble as they drive their bad boy transporter.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsays Road Trip
programme.desc: Gordon wants to show Fred and Gino that the food and fresh produce are off the charts! In Las Vegas they indulge in one of the most expensive beef burgers. After a night at the casino theyre on the road again to experience the real wild west.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsays Road Trip
programme.desc: Gino and Fred are excited to head to San Francisco for their very own Summer of Love. Gordon tries to embrace the flower power mood, but hes more interested in the 61 Michelin Stars. The boys travel to a Napa Valley vineyard in a hot air balloon.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsays Road Trip
programme.sub-title: Mamma Mia! Off We Go Again
programme.desc: Gordon, Gino and Fred travel to Greece to immerse themselves in the culinary traditions. The taste buddies go island-hopping, keen to learn more about the Mediterranean diet and how the country has one of the healthiest populations in the world.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsays Road Trip
programme.sub-title: Go Greek! Clash of the Titans
programme.desc: The boys are in the Greek capital Athens in a vintage VW campervan. This is where high-concept cuisine originated and is still being re-invented, in a city known as the birth place of democracy and the cradle of western civilisation.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Seasons
programme.sub-title: Stuffed Salmon Celebration and Almond Custard Tart
programme.desc: Jamie snazzes up some spuds with wild garlic pesto, creates a broad bean mezze, rustles up a beautiful spring salad and honours rhubarb in a luscious custard tart with almond brittle.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Seasons
programme.sub-title: Summer-y Sweet Pea Risotto and Slow Roasted Pork
programme.desc: Jamie celebrates summer with roasted fennel pork and gratin, oozy pea risotto, and rainbow slaw chicken wraps. He shares edible hanging basket tips. The feast finishes with stunning mackerel on sun-dried tomato couscous with colorful beets.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Seasons
programme.desc: Jamie kicks off autumn with Italian-inspired cheesy cabbage pasta and smoky sweetcorn burgers with feta. He shares tips for storing onions and saving tomato seeds, finishing with a beautiful tomato galette for a perfect fall meal.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Seasons
programme.sub-title: Buddys Strawberry Rice Pudding and Summer Tomato Chicken Bake
programme.desc: Jamie cooks a chicken sheet pan dinner with early tomatoes, potatoes and chorizo. Buddy helps pick strawberries for quick jam rice pudding. The summer feast ends with spicy shrimp skewers with homegrown chillies and a refreshing cucumber gazpacho.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Seasons
programme.sub-title: Endless Summer: From Grilled Panzanella Salad to Sour Cherry Tart
programme.desc: Jamie ends summer with crispy duck in a rich plum sauce and roast potatoes. Grilled peppers star in panzanella. Garden zucchini become Mediterranean rice. Sweet finale: sour cherry frangipane with crème fraîche.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Seasons
programme.desc: Jamie kicks off autumn with Italian-inspired cheesy cabbage pasta and smoky sweetcorn burgers with feta. He shares tips for storing onions and saving tomato seeds, finishing with a beautiful tomato galette for a perfect fall meal.

programme.title: The Bill

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The team investigate when an abandoned car is found with traces of blood nearby. The car belongs to Ajay Kapur, but his family claim that he flew to India earlier that day. The officers keep digging, and find that Mr Kapur did not go to India - and that he was being followed. Mrs Kapur eventually admits that her husband has been kidnapped. The police organise a sting to get him back, but will the operation go smoothly?

programme.title: The Bill

programme.title: Classic EastEnders

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: A retired jewel thief regales Marina and Davenport with fanciful stories of his past exploits in the South of France. When Aunty Wainwright finds an old safe without a key, who better to open it?

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Old wounds are reopened when Lynley investigates the disturbing death of his godson more than a decade after the boys disappearance. programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The police investigate when the body of a missing boy, 11-year-old Matty Wallace, is found in local woodland. His stressed mother Jane claims she did not realise Matty was missing until she went to his school, while his stepfather tells officers he was working away for several days and knew nothing of Mattys disappearance. The team discover that Matty had planned to run away with a friend, but did not make it.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Grace and Neil attend the funeral of Matty Wallace with the boys stepfather Craig Gant - unaware that Max has ordered an observation order on Gant and his associates. Max discovers that Gant has a criminal record for handling stolen goods but believes there is more to it. Then Terry recognises one of the mourners as someone known to the team for GBH and robbery. Will Maxs suspicions about Gant be confirmed?

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The team are on the trail of Nigel Wren who has been grooming young girls online, posing as a 13-year-old. When Jacob and Terry enter Wrens home to put a trace on his internet activity, they discover he has made an arrangement to meet teenager Kelli Sutton. Believing that the rendezvous is at Waterloo, the officers deploy there, find Wren and arrest him - but there is no sign of Kelli.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The team investigate when an abandoned car is found with traces of blood nearby. The car belongs to Ajay Kapur, but his family claim that he flew to India earlier that day. The officers keep digging, and find that Mr Kapur did not go to India - and that he was being followed. Mrs Kapur eventually admits that her husband has been kidnapped. The police organise a sting to get him back, but will the operation go smoothly?

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: PCs Kirsty Knight and Leon Taylor discover a womans body on the local rubbish tip. She is identified as Luisa Dias and tests show that she had been drowned. Searching her flat, the officers find her brother Roberto. He tells them that she was on the verge of leaving her partner Dominic, but was worried about how he would react. Dominic and the couples young son have disappeared, and the PCs worry about the boys safety.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo hits the West End to explore an exotic store, which was a favourite among Edwardian ladies. At Covent Gardens Royal Ballet School he hears how in 1909 a Russian ballet company took London by storm and how its prima ballerina inspired the schools founding choreographer. Leaving the capital from Charing Cross, Michael heads for Dartford in Kent, where he discovers the origins of netball and gymslips at the North Kent College.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches Birmingham and discovers how a radical reformer would make his mark on the city of a thousand trades. At Highbury Hall he finds Joseph Chamberlains splendid mansion home and hears how he established a political dynasty including a Prime Minister and a Foreign Secretary.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael heads for Maltby, where he is caught up with the thrill of the chase as he investigates the high-octane sport of whippet racing. He learns how this `poor mans sport grew during the 19th century in the mining towns of the north and retains its appeal today.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Warwick to Rye in East Sussex. In the orchards of East Malling, Kent, Michael discovers that the Edwardians serious attitude towards cultivation bore fruit. Rootstock developed at the NIAB Centre for Fruit Research, established in 1913, is today responsible for much of world apple production.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey through western Scotland by exploring the industrial heartland of Glasgow and its mighty River Clyde before taking the ferry to the island of Cumbrae. He is put to work behind the scenes at Glasgows circular subway, explores the future of shipbuilding on the Clyde.
