programme.title: Shipwreck Secrets
programme.desc: The discovery of a wreck fitted with a large deck gun off the coast of Florida sends a team of underwater explorers on a mission to discover the identity of a ship that simply shouldnt exist. Their investigation uncovers just how close Nazi Germany got to the United States during WWII and how a secret war was waged on the US coast without public knowledge.

programme.title: Shipwreck Secrets
programme.desc: Underwater explorers search for the wreck of a ship believed to have gone missing over 100 years ago in the Bermuda Triangle. What they discover is a tale of tragedy, but their investigation brings closure to the families of those lost at sea.

programme.title: Shipwreck Secrets
programme.desc: During the height of the first world war, the troop carrier SS Justicia became embroiled in a 24-hour long battle with a pack of German U-Boats. Her sinking was celebrated in Germany and mourned in Britain. Now, a group of underwater explorers have discovered a new wreck in the North Atlantic that could shed a whole new light on the events that took place that fateful day.

programme.title: Shipwreck Secrets
programme.desc: After the US launched an attack on the Japanese imperial fleet in Micronesia during WWII, Chuuk Lagoon became home to one of the greatest underwater graveyards in the world. Exploring an unknown wreck discovered on a sonar hit nearly 20 years ago.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo boldly goes to the moon by way of the Cornish Riviera Express! On the trail of an historic achievement made at the dawn of the Edwardian era, he investigates the first radio signal to be sent across the Atlantic.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael strikes gold at the Royal Mint in Llantrisant where after much frisking, he gains access to the inner vaults. At Cardiff Arms Park, Michael revisits the scene of a triumphant Welsh victory over the fearsome All Blacks and hears from Welsh international, Gerald Davies, how the Welsh national anthem kicked the intimidating Haka into touch.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo is in the steel city of Sheffield, where he discovers an enormous and beautifully preserved early 20th century steam engine. At 400 tons and packing 12,000 horsepower, it produced armour plate for the most feared warship of the Royal Navy.

programme.title: Secret Army
programme.desc: Brussels 1941 - `Lifeline is a secret organisation dedicated to aiding the escape of Allied airmen shot down over Europe. The organisation is run by a young woman known as `Yvette. London sends an RAF officer to help co-ordinate their activities, but the Gestapo is also interested.

programme.title: Secret Army
programme.desc: A Royal Air Force NCOs suspect must be eliminated when his sensitivity endangers the escape route.

programme.title: Secret Army
programme.desc: Curtis brings money from England for Lifeline and becomes involved with a Jewish family - as well as with Yvette.

programme.desc: Derek gives the once-over to a Royale Formula Ford race car, and Paul is on a marathon trip to Teesside to pick up a 1953 MGYB, a Moggy Van and an 80s Yamaha 250RD motorbike.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek travels to the Lancashire coast to pick up a rare 1972 Citroen SM, and Dave is on HQ duties and admires a Punto thats two decades old but has just 42 miles on the clock.

programme.desc: Derek checks out an abandoned 1985 Renault 4 and an MGB Roadster that hasnt seen the light of day for 36 years, and Jack heads to Rotherham to pick up a pair of rare Bond Bugs.

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Observing the dramatic, emotional and often funny moments that go hand in hand with bringing a new life into the world, from the perspective of the soon-to-be parents and family, as well as the hospital staff. In this first episode, 37-year-old Tracy is in labour with her fourth child. She is calm and upbeat about her labour until the heart rate of her baby slows and the midwife needs to deliver her baby quickly.

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Sam is in labour with her first child and is finding the pain too much to bear. Her boyfriend Ed, mum and the midwife team are doing everything they can to make her more comfortable, but she becomes increasingly upset. Ed is feeling the pressure too: he knows he has some real responsibilities to face once the baby is born and is worried about their finances.

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Lisas baby Jack has been born with his bowel outside his body. The first few days of his life are critical as he faces serious medical procedures. Lisa is forced to cope with waiting weeks before she can take him home, and confesses to feeling jealous of the nurses who are feeding him before she can even hold him. Meanwhile, Sarah is expecting her second child.

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Kelly comes in to have her fifth baby, while Joy is waiting to have her first. Babies have always come easily for Kelly: her last one was delivered three minutes after her waters broke. Joy, on the other hand, has had to undergo five years of IVF, and after days of waiting in hospital, theres still no sign of baby.

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Abbie and Ross are both 17 and have been together for three years. Abbie says: "We were careful, but things happen, and things happen for a reason". Her mum Donna, a paramedic, has delivered 15 babies, but that cant prepare her for the emotional wrench of her baby having a baby. Twenty-three-year-old self-confessed free spirit Leoni had only been with her babys father for a short time when she fell pregnant.

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Two mothers are about to give birth to their first babies while two fathers are trying to work out their role in the birthing process. For Shelaghs baby son it is a dramatic start with an ambulance journey to the hospital and a quick turn around caesarean when his heart rate dips during labour. Penny is also excited about her new arrival but when labour starts her husband Ben finds it difficult.

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Veterinarian Noel Fitzpatrick is one of Englands top animal doctors and the subject of 2010 documentary programme `The Bionic Vet, which showcased some of the work done at his Surrey clinic. On `The Supervet Fitzpatrick and his staff treat some of the countrys hardest-to-cure pets with cutting-edge treatments and surgery. The programme tells the emotional stories of the pets, their owners and the passionate team that push the boundaries of veterinary medicine to save the animals from life-threatening conditions.

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Supervet Noel Fitzpatrick returns to help more animals with hard-to-cure ailments. Noel and his team help a giant Newfoundland puppy called Lola. Also, a golden Labrador needs a bionic solution for a deformed front paw.

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance at Christmas
programme.desc: Jamie and Stuart race to a supermarket where a man has collapsed doing his Christmas food shopping, while Dan and Holly visit a familiar patient.

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance at Christmas
programme.desc: Its Christmas Day and Richard and Adam help a family who face a tragic loss, while Dan and Becky are called out to a baby with a high temperature.

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: A girl has an operation to have squints in both eyes realigned, a man has his infected gall bladder removed and an ex-police officer is having a grommet inserted in her ear.

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: A woman has an operation to repair the hernia she suffered while giving birth and a four-year-olds ear blockage is so bad he needs a general anaesthetic to have it sucked out.

programme.title: Ski AandE

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Observing the dramatic, emotional and often funny moments that go hand in hand with bringing a new life into the world, from the perspective of the soon-to-be parents and family, as well as the hospital staff. In this first episode, 37-year-old Tracy is in labour with her fourth child. She is calm and upbeat about her labour until the heart rate of her baby slows and the midwife needs to deliver her baby quickly.

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Sam is in labour with her first child and is finding the pain too much to bear. Her boyfriend Ed, mum and the midwife team are doing everything they can to make her more comfortable, but she becomes increasingly upset. Ed is feeling the pressure too: he knows he has some real responsibilities to face once the baby is born and is worried about their finances.

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Lisas baby Jack has been born with his bowel outside his body. The first few days of his life are critical as he faces serious medical procedures. Lisa is forced to cope with waiting weeks before she can take him home, and confesses to feeling jealous of the nurses who are feeding him before she can even hold him. Meanwhile, Sarah is expecting her second child.

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Kelly comes in to have her fifth baby, while Joy is waiting to have her first. Babies have always come easily for Kelly: her last one was delivered three minutes after her waters broke. Joy, on the other hand, has had to undergo five years of IVF, and after days of waiting in hospital, theres still no sign of baby.

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Abbie and Ross are both 17 and have been together for three years. Abbie says: "We were careful, but things happen, and things happen for a reason". Her mum Donna, a paramedic, has delivered 15 babies, but that cant prepare her for the emotional wrench of her baby having a baby. Twenty-three-year-old self-confessed free spirit Leoni had only been with her babys father for a short time when she fell pregnant.

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Two mothers are about to give birth to their first babies while two fathers are trying to work out their role in the birthing process. For Shelaghs baby son it is a dramatic start with an ambulance journey to the hospital and a quick turn around caesarean when his heart rate dips during labour. Penny is also excited about her new arrival but when labour starts her husband Ben finds it difficult.

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Veterinarian Noel Fitzpatrick is one of Englands top animal doctors and the subject of 2010 documentary programme `The Bionic Vet, which showcased some of the work done at his Surrey clinic. On `The Supervet Fitzpatrick and his staff treat some of the countrys hardest-to-cure pets with cutting-edge treatments and surgery. The programme tells the emotional stories of the pets, their owners and the passionate team that push the boundaries of veterinary medicine to save the animals from life-threatening conditions.

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Supervet Noel Fitzpatrick returns to help more animals with hard-to-cure ailments. Noel and his team help a giant Newfoundland puppy called Lola. Also, a golden Labrador needs a bionic solution for a deformed front paw.

programme.desc: Jamie and Stuart race to a supermarket where a man has collapsed doing his Christmas food shopping, while Dan and Holly visit a familiar patient.

programme.desc: In the surgery this time, a fluffy Persian cat that has been hit by a car, requiring complex treatment, a rescue dog has a tumour in his jaw, and a young staffie-cross with a sore elbow.

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A puppy called Albie has a broken back from being knocked over by a car and needs a complex operation. Also, a Scottish terrier has a mysterious ailment never seen before and Noel must use old-fashioned detective work to find out what is wrong.

programme.title: Ski AandE

programme.title: Ski AandE

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: Having survived seven tough challenges, this week the two finalists go head-to-head for the ultimate prize. Awaiting the winner is a career-defining contract to design an apartment for an upmarket coastal resort on the Cornish coast. Judge Michelle Ogundehin dispatches the finalists to Londons vibrant Soho district, where each designer takes on the redesign of a trendy bar.

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: In Dudley, Ash and Jamie rush to the aid of a frightened young woman who is suffering from severe chest pains. Rachel and Mick are called to assist the police with a prisoner in Stoke.

programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Guided by his Bradshaws 1913 Handbook of Indian, Foreign and Colonial Travel, Michael Portillo embarks on a classic rail journey from Amritsar to Shimla. Along the way he helps to feed the thousands at the worlds largest free kitchen and travels the railway routes used by millions of migrants during Partition. He gives his trademark colourful wardrobe an Indian twist.

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Series following a group of trawler fishermen in Peterhead, Scotland. Prawn boat Amity is in the grip of a winter storm, 100 miles from shore, with its nets caught on the seabed. Skipper Jimmy Buchan and his crew battle to save the boat and themselves. Elsewhere, a rival prawn trawler is filling its nets. Skippered by the young and ambitious James West, Fruitful Bough is one of the most successful boats in Peterhead.

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Jimmy Buchan, skipper of the prawn trawler Amity, has just hours to decide whether to run through a storm to Peterhead or try and ride it out. Fruitful Bough, another prawn boat, is also wondering what to do - face the mountainous seas and gale force winds or lose vital fishing time by taking shelter in the Shetland Islands? Away from the storm, the whitefish boat Ocean Venture isnt catching any valuable haddock.

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Ocean Venture has headed north and is fishing at `The Edge, only 150 miles south of the Arctic Circle. Having failed to catch enough fish, skipper John Buchan is taking a huge risk in the deep and treacherous waters of the North Atlantic in a bid to find the perfect catch. With the previous nights storm over, Amity gets back to the business of trying to catch prawns.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A classic car fan with a love of the Jaguar E-Type reluctantly sends his dream car to auction, hoping to buy a motorhome. Two Ford Escorts get Daves pulse racing.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A widow reluctantly parts with her husbands treasured collection of Rolls Royces and Bentleys, and an impulse buyer finds one of the cars a new home.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Jacks off to East Yorkshire for an iconic 80s motor, where a Ford enthusiast is thinning out his herd of nine Escorts.

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus and Will are on the hunt for an affordable Italian car. They find an Alfa Romeo 155 hiding in a barn, so making space for an inspection proves a challenge.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.sub-title: To the Ends of the Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough travels to the ends of the earth on an extraordinary journey across the polar regions of our planet. The Arctic and Antarctic are the greatest and least known wildernesses of all - magical ice worlds inhabited by the most bizarre and hardy creatures on earth. At the North Pole, the sun returns after six months of darkness. A pair of courting polar bears reveal a surprisingly tender side.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: After months of darkness the sun returns. The landscape is dynamically transformed and millions of migrants join the hardy residents as they find mates and begin to breed.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: It is high summer in the polar regions, and the sun never sets. Vast hordes of summer visitors cram a lifetime of drama into one long, magical day; they must feed, fight and rear their young in this brief window of plenty. Summer is a tough time for the polar bear family, as their ice world melts away and the cubs take their first swimming lesson.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: Polar landscapes in autumn are transformed as the big freeze returns. Most animals leave on epic journeys, some now battle to breed, and for the hardy few its a time of opportunity. In the Arctic, polar bears gather in large numbers on the coast to wait for the return of the ice. Tempers soon fray and violent contests break out. Off the coast 2,000 beluga whales head for a special estuary, a gigantic `whale spa.

programme.title: Ireland with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon begins his journey in the south of Ireland, para-motoring with an Irish explorer. On the west coast he does spot of surfing, before climbing Croagh Patrick in honour of Irelands patron saint. This leg of his journey ends in Malin Head, Irelands most northerly point.

programme.desc: Simon Reeves journey around the spectacular Indian Ocean takes him from Oman to the Maldives. He starts in the remote and otherworldly Musandam peninsula on the Strait of Hormuz, one of the most strategically important waterways in the world, where oil from the Persian Gulf is shipped through the narrow channel out into the Indian Ocean. The journey takes him on to Mumbai, the Indian Oceans biggest port.

programme.desc: Explore Oradour-sur-Glane, a French town drenched in infamy, the victim of a notorious raid, Alcatraz, a facility famed for breakouts, subjected to a daring break-in, and Sealand, a micronation off the English coast, stormed by a band of mercenaries.

programme.title: Dhoom
programme.desc: A gang of robbers on hi-tech motorbikes, led by the charismatic Kabir, is sweeping through Mumbai, outwitting the police at every turn. When officer Jai Dixit is assigned to catch the criminals, he reluctantly enlists the help of garage mechanic and bike enthusiast Ali. Though the pair do not see eye-to-eye at first, they soon become a formidable team, tracking their enemies from the streets of Mumbai to the beaches of Goa.
